typeProperties.script:
source(output(
		movie as integer,
		title as string,
		genres as string,
		year as short,
		Rating as short,
		RottenTomato as short
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: false,
	partitionBy('external', 16)) ~> source1
source(output(
		movie as integer,
		title as string,
		genres as string,
		year as integer,
		Rating as integer,
		RottenTomato as integer
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	isolationLevel: 'READ_UNCOMMITTED',
	format: 'table',
	partitionColumn: 'movie',
	partitionBy('external', 16)) ~> source2
source(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: false,
	wildcardPaths:['output/demoout1/movies2021.csv']) ~> source3
AlterRow1 derive(year = 2021) ~> DerivedColumn1
source2 filter(year == 2021) ~> Filter1
source1 alterRow(updateIf(year==1980)) ~> AlterRow1
source3 aggregate(rowcount = count(1)) ~> RowCount
DerivedColumn1 sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	input(
		movie as integer,
		title as string,
		genres as string,
		year as integer,
		Rating as integer,
		RottenTomato as integer
	),
	deletable:false,
	insertable:false,
	updateable:true,
	upsertable:false,
	keys:['movie'],
	format: 'table',
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true,
	saveOrder: 1,
	errorHandlingOption: 'stopOnFirstError') ~> sink1
Filter1 sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:['movies2021.csv'],
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true,
	saveOrder: 2,
	partitionBy('hash', 1)) ~> sink2
RowCount sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:['movies2021rowcount.csv'],
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true,
	saveOrder: 3,
	partitionBy('hash', 1)) ~> sink3

source(output(
		body as ({@context} as string[], geometry as (coordinates as double[][][], type as string), properties as (elevation as (unitCode as string, value as double), forecastGenerator as string, generatedAt as string, periods as (detailedForecast as string, endTime as string, icon as string, isDaytime as boolean, name as string, number as short, shortForecast as string, startTime as string, temperature as short, temperatureTrend as string, temperatureUnit as boolean, windDirection as string, windSpeed as string)[], units as string, updateTime as string, updated as string, validTimes as string), type as string),
		headers as [string,string]
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	httpMethod: 'GET',
	timeout: 30,
	requestInterval: 0,
	paginationRules: ['supportRFC5988' -> 'true'],
	responseFormat: ['type' -> 'json', 'documentForm' -> 'documentPerLine']) ~> source1
source1 stringify(mydata = body.properties.periods ? string,
	format: 'json') ~> Stringify1
Stringify1 select(mapColumn(
		context = mydata
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> Select1
Select1 sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true,
	saveOrder: 1) ~> sink1

source(output(
		medallion as string,
		{ hack_license} as string,
		{ vendor_id} as string,
		{ pickup_datetime} as timestamp,
		{ payment_type} as string,
		{ fare_amount} as double,
		{ surcharge} as double,
		{ mta_tax} as double,
		{ tip_amount} as double,
		{ tolls_amount} as double,
		{ total_amount} as double
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: false) ~> taxiSource
source(output(
		medallion as string,
		hack_license as string,
		vendor_id as string,
		rate_code as short,
		store_and_fwd_flag as boolean,
		pickup_datetime as timestamp,
		dropoff_datetime as timestamp,
		passenger_count as short,
		trip_time_in_secs as short,
		trip_distance as double,
		pickup_longitude as double,
		pickup_latitude as double,
		dropoff_longitude as double,
		dropoff_latitude as double
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: false) ~> tripSource
taxiSource, tripSource join(taxiSource@medallion == tripSource@medallion
	&& { hack_license} == hack_license,
	joinType:'inner',
	broadcast: 'auto')~> Join1
Join1 aggregate(groupBy(passenger_count),
	avgAmount = round(avg({ total_amount}),2),
		avgTip = round(avg({ tip_amount}),2)) ~> Aggregate1
Aggregate1 sort(desc(avgTip, true)) ~> Sort1
Join1 aggregate(groupBy(round_distance = round(trip_distance)),
	avgAmount2 = round(avg({ total_amount}),2),
		avgTip2 = round(avg({ tip_amount}),2)) ~> Aggregate2
Aggregate2 sort(desc(avgTip2, true)) ~> Sort2
Sort2 sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	format: 'delta',
	fileSystem: 'mycontainer',
	folderPath: 'deltataxi',
	truncate:true,
	mergeSchema: false,
	autoCompact: false,
	optimizedWrite: false,
	vacuum: 0,
	deletable:false,
	insertable:true,
	updateable:false,
	upsertable:false,
	umask: 0022,
	preCommands: [],
	postCommands: [],
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> sink1

source(output(
		ss_sold_time_sk as integer,
		ss_item_sk as integer,
		ss_customer_sk as integer,
		ss_cdemo_sk as integer,
		ss_hdemo_sk as integer,
		ss_addr_sk as integer,
		ss_store_sk as integer,
		ss_promo_sk as integer,
		ss_ticket_number as long,
		ss_quantity as integer,
		ss_wholesale_cost as decimal(7,2),
		ss_list_price as decimal(7,2),
		ss_sales_price as decimal(7,2),
		ss_ext_discount_amt as decimal(7,2),
		ss_ext_sales_price as decimal(7,2),
		ss_ext_wholesale_cost as decimal(7,2),
		ss_ext_list_price as decimal(7,2),
		ss_ext_tax as decimal(7,2),
		ss_coupon_amt as decimal(7,2),
		ss_net_paid as decimal(7,2),
		ss_net_paid_inc_tax as decimal(7,2),
		ss_net_profit as decimal(7,2),
		ss_sold_date_sk as string
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: true,
	partitionRootPath: 'tpcsales',
	format: 'parquet',
	wildcardPaths:['SampleData/tpcds/tpcsales/**/*']) ~> source1
source(output(
		d_date_sk as integer,
		d_date_id as string,
		d_date as date,
		d_month_seq as integer,
		d_week_seq as integer,
		d_quarter_seq as integer,
		d_year as integer,
		d_dow as integer,
		d_moy as integer,
		d_dom as integer,
		d_qoy as integer,
		d_fy_year as integer,
		d_fy_quarter_seq as integer,
		d_fy_week_seq as integer,
		d_day_name as string,
		d_quarter_name as string,
		d_holiday as string,
		d_weekend as string,
		d_following_holiday as string,
		d_first_dom as integer,
		d_last_dom as integer,
		d_same_day_ly as integer,
		d_same_day_lq as integer,
		d_current_day as string,
		d_current_week as string,
		d_current_month as string,
		d_current_quarter as string,
		d_current_year as string
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: false,
	format: 'parquet') ~> source2
source1, source2 join(ss_sold_time_sk == d_date_sk,
	joinType:'inner',
	broadcast: 'right')~> Join1
Join1 filter(d_year == 2002) ~> Filter1
Filter1 sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true,
	mapColumn(
		SSDate = ss_sold_time_sk,
		DDate = d_date_sk,
		{DYear } = d_year
	)) ~> sink1

source(output(
		movie as string,
		title as string,
		genres as string,
		year as string,
		Rating as string,
		RottenTomato as string
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: false) ~> movies
source(output(
		medallion as string,
		hack_license as string,
		vendor_id as string,
		rate_code as string,
		store_and_fwd_flag as string,
		pickup_datetime as string,
		dropoff_datetime as string,
		passenger_count as string,
		trip_time_in_secs as string,
		trip_distance as string,
		pickup_longitude as string,
		pickup_latitude as string,
		dropoff_longitude as string,
		dropoff_latitude as string
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: false) ~> taxiSource
Filter1 derive(movie = '999979',
		title = 'Mark Story') ~> DerivedColumn1
movies filter(title == 'Toy Story') ~> Filter1
DerivedColumn1 select(mapColumn(
		movie,
		title,
		genres,
		year,
		Rating,
		RottenTomato
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> Select1
taxiSource derive(month = split(pickup_datetime,'-')[2],
		year = toInteger(split(pickup_datetime,'-')[1])+1,
		day = split(split(pickup_datetime,' ')[1],'-')[3]) ~> decompdatetime
Select1 sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	format: 'parquet',
	umask: 0022,
	preCommands: [],
	postCommands: [],
	partitionBy('key',
		0,
		year
	)) ~> sink1
decompdatetime sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	format: 'parquet',
	partitionBy('key',
		0,
		year,
		month,
		day
	)) ~> taxiSink

dataflowSinks.name: SinkSQLMovies
dataflowSinks.script:
sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	input(
		movie as integer,
		title as string,
		genres as string,
		year as integer,
		Rating as integer,
		RottenTomato as integer
	),
	deletable:false,
	insertable:true,
	updateable:false,
	upsertable:false,
	format: 'table',
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true,
	errorHandlingOption: 'stopOnFirstError',
	mapColumn(
		movie,
		title,
		genres,
		year,
		Rating
	)) ~> SinkSQLMovies

properties.description: Dynamic column replacement in mapping data flows
This pipeline will copy one batch of objects. The objects belonging to this batch will be copied parallelly.

activities.name: DivideOneBatchIntoMultipleGroups
activities.description: Divide objects from single batch into multiple sub parallel groups to avoid reaching the output limit of lookup activity.

activities.name: GetObjectsPerGroupToCopy
activities.description: Get objects (tables etc.) from control table required to be copied in this group. The order of objects to be copied following the TaskId in control table (ORDER BY [TaskId] DESC).

activities.name: CopyObjectsInOneGroup
activities.description: Execute another pipeline to copy objects from one group. The objects belonging to this group will be copied parallelly.

properties.description: Calculating average movie rating by genre and year using Power Query

activities.name: AverageMovieRating
activities.description: Calculating average movie rating by genre and year

dataflowSinks.name: MovieSink
dataflowSinks.script:
sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	umask: 0022,
	preCommands: [],
	postCommands: [],
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> MovieSink

properties.description:
Moving average example using Microsoft stock prices from Quandl CSV data:

https://www.quandl.com/data/EOD/MSFT-Microsoft-Corporation-MSFT-Stock-Prices-Dividends-and-Splits
Sample pipeline that uses data flow to partition output based on incoming source file size

This pipeline will count the total number of objects (tables etc.) required to be copied in this run, come up with the number of sequential batches based on the max allowed concurrent copy task, and then execute another pipeline to copy different batches sequentially.

activities.name: Iterate over files
activities.description: Come up with the number of sequential batches based on the max allowed concurrent copy tasks, and then execute another pipeline to copy different batches sequentially.
